title: current MySQL driver fails to fetch PK name when the PK has USING option
body:
Given the following MySQL table (you know we sometimes should unfortunately work on some legacy DB or non-Rails DB like this):

```SQL```
CREATE TABLE `btree_pk_tables` (
  `id` int(11) NOT NULL auto_increment,
  PRIMARY KEY  USING BTREE (`id`)
)
```

`BtreePkTable.primary_key` becomes `nil` because of Regexp bug.
Attached a patch with test cases. Tested on MySQL 5.1, Ruby 1.9.3.

Because this bug happens on current stable version of AR, I hope this to be backported to 3-2-stable branch. I confirmed that the Regexp works either on Ruby 1.9 and Ruby 1.8.7, so it should work.

title: Readds the fix for #5667 and back ports the regression fix from #5718
body: This reverts the revert of the fix for #5667 and backports the fix for the regression (#5718) described in #5667 to 3-2-stable.

title: Revert #5861
body:
This reverts commit 9b14e3f.

Rationale: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/5861#issuecomment-5212898

title: Expose ActiveSupport::Autoload.autoloads
body:
Preloading AR doesn't work when no `ActionDispatch` is available since `AR::SessionStore` inherits from `ActionDispatch::Something`.

So I needed `ActiveSupport::Autoload.autoloads` to remove `SessionStore` from preloading.
I discovered that `autoloads` is a instance method and is used nowhere, so I guess this was overlooked.

title: Fix nil logger on 3.2
body:
The logger can sometimes be `nil` when AR records are used outside of Rails, this adds a check.

This patch is not necessary on 3-1-stable or master.

title: ASP.net json date compatibility
body:
Added a compatibility mode for asp.net style json date + time encoding. This is evidently a common format in the .net world (for example http://stackoverflow.com/questions/206384/how-to-format-a-json-date just refers to it as the json date format).

Some times ruby people like me have to play nicely with .net (whilst we secretly plot its doom). Hopefully this will save the future peoples some trouble.

EDIT: for clarity the asp.net format I am refering to looks like: "/Date(1224043200000)/"

title: Remove unused and duplicated code. We should use 'active_support/time.rb'.
body:
I guess that this code isn't used and we should use active_support/time.rb.

sorry and close it, if I'm wrong.

title: Add module stats to rake stats task
body: The rake stats task was not showing any information about modules, with this change a module column shows in rake stats output.

title: Add missing dependency for active_record_deprecated_finders
body:
When running 
ruby railties/bin/rails new /tmp/myapp --dev
Bundle install fails because active_record_deprecated_finders gem is not released.
I added the gem dependency pointing to the git repo in the generated Gemfile.

title: Add documentation to the SpawnMethods#merge method.
body:
`SpawnMethods#merge` has been left conspicuously un-documented for quite a while. 

Here, I've added some documentation to it so that it is clear what the method does, and added some usage examples.

title: Added option to pass block to link_to_function
body:
Patch to solve issue here: https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/3093

Allows you to pass a block to link_to_function (similar to link_to) if the link text is too complex to be passed as a string argument.

title: Fixing the build
body: Refactor the code to a simpler form instead of depending on and/&& semantics.

title: More flexible ranges behaviour. Allows to validate inclusion in numeric ...
body: ...range of custom accessor in model.

title: Stamp out ruby-debug with debugger every where else in the code base
body: Just re-opening #5875 with a cleaner patch.

title: Fix #5847 and #4045. Force load AR::Base before loading an application model.
body:
This PR closes #5847 and #4045.
Please see these issues

I think these commits should be merged to 3-2-stable.
And the testcase only should be merged to master (already passed), because AR::Base is loaded initially. 
meybe by https://github.com/rails/rails/commit/d0bb43d621c471659d03504f48f0197c0ae3b57c

title: Refactor Observer.observed_class
Return routing redirect :path interpolation
body:
This feature was implemented at 0bda6f1ec664fcfd1b312492a6419e3d76d5baa7, documented by 1e26bda0959c313ce5c1816bf4958b542050e5e2 and removed at 0809c675ef5831852b7c1aa8497402b2beff5185.

But the description is still here: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/actionpack/lib/action_dispatch/routing/redirection.rb#L75-79

I suggest to reimplement it (it's simple only 3 lines of code in this PR) or remove it from the documentation.

@joshk, @tenderlove what do yout think about it?

title: Stamping out ruby-debug19 and its cohorts with extreme prejudice
body:
Thank you ````ruby-debug19```` you served us well. Time for NKOTB.

Previous commit #5835 only removed the most obvious and visible +ruby-debug19+ presence (in a new Rails app's Gemfile), this pull request one goes postal on ruby-debug* within guides and other generated messages.

/cc @vijaydev Feel free to further edit/improve the guides.

title: replace ruby-debug19 with debugger on Rails 3-2 stable
body: In continuance of #5835 , an appropriate patch to weed out ruby-debug19 from Rails-3-2 master as well. It is likely a large number of people are going to generate new Rails 3.2 apps on ruby1.9.3 for sometime in the future. The guidance should be to use the debugger gem on that platform.

title: Add to guides info how to disable prepared statements
body: Now it's impossible to find in docs, how to disable prepared statements in postgresql

title: Remove prepared statement from system query in postgresql adapter
body:
When we use external connection pool manager (pgBouncer, for example), and set prepared_statements to false, system query still use prepared statements and we can get error like this:

```
activerecord-3.2.3/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/postgresql_adapter.rb:1180:in `prepare': PG::Error: ERROR:  prepared statement "a1" already exists (ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid)
:             SELECT COUNT(*)
            FROM pg_class c
            LEFT JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace
            WHERE c.relkind in ('v','r')
            AND c.relname = $1
            AND n.nspname = ANY (current_schemas(false))
```

This errors occur because we try to create prepared statement in reused postgresql session, where this prepared statement already exists.

title: Remove unused test code.
body:
ActionController::RoutingError are raised in router execution time and can
not be rescued in a controller.

title: Changes b tag to strong
body: The change is made due to importance of the attribute name (e.g. Name:) on the page (versus just stylistic / appearance sake tag).

title: Catch nil.to_sym errors in partial_renderer, and raise ArgumentError instead
body:
Rendering a partial with a path, but missing filename like this...

```render :partial => "templates/subdir/"```

raises this error:

```undefined method `to_sym' for nil:NilClass```

from ```ActionView::PartialRenderer#retrieve_variable``` because it doesn't match the template name regexp. I think instead that method should return ```variable``` as ```nil``` instead, raising the ```ArgumentError``` further on instead.

(there's a corresponding pull request for master too: https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/5865)

title: Catch nil.to_sym errors in partial_renderer, and raise ArgumentError instead
body:
Rendering a partial with a path, but missing filename like this...

```render :partial => "templates/subdir/"```

raises this error:

```undefined method `to_sym' for nil:NilClass```

from ```ActionView::PartialRenderer#retrieve_variable``` because it doesn't match the template name regexp. I think instead that method should return ```variable``` as ```nil``` instead, raising the ```ArgumentError``` further on instead.

title: remove autoload for OrderedHash, usages removed already
body: remove autoload for OrderedHash, usages removed already

title: Make log_level explicit in production.rb template
body:
The 'production' environment name is currently checked for setting up
the default log_level to 'info' but that won't work if the environment
is copied to staging.rb, for instance. Better to have it explicitly set.

Please, take a look at the whole discussion in this thread:

https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/rubyonrails-core/sLG7EpAWQfg

title: multi_json upgrade and also updated the new API
body: Already in master 57baa0e97aa4b444706007fe5b9e9ecb5e462df5

title: Multi json fix 3 2 stable
body: It's using new API now.

body:
Multi_json also upgraded.

They have upgraded there API. This PR will fix build. Also need to backport in 3-2-stable I guess.
